alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 24 at 6:41PM MDT until October 25 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 10 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM MDT Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM Wednesday to 6 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A break in the snow is expected during the day on Wednesday before another wave of snow overspreads the area Wednesday night and into the day on Thursday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
